title: Read JSON output from inference with TreePPL — read_treeppl_output
code: if (FALSE) {   # the common case is that read_treeppl_output is used within run_treeppl()   # if you run treeppl outside of R, you can use this function to read in the output.   logs <- read_treeppl_output("output/stdout.json", sample_freq = 1000) }

what: Compile and run a TreePPL program — run_treeppl
title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — run_treeppl
Compile and run a TreePPL program — run_treeppl
code: run_treeppl(   source,   data_path,   method = "smc-bpf",   samples = 1000,   chains = 1,   out_path = NULL,   name_exe = "out",   sample_freq = NULL )

title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — run_treeppl
text: source File path TreePPL source program. data_path Complete path JSON file input data. Created treeppl_input(). method Inference method used. samples number samples/particles inference. Default 1000 samples. chains number chains/sweeps. chain contain number samples passed samples. Default 1 chain. out_path Path JSON file outputed TreePPL. name_exe Name executable compiled source. sample_freq sweep/chain, sample one particle/sample every sample_freq particles/samples.

title: Compile and run a TreePPL program — run_treeppl
text: data frame sampled values, log weights, normalized weights, normalizing constant samples.

text: object_list list R objects included JSON input file. file_path complete path JSON file written.

title: Prepare input for inference with TreePPL — treeppl_input
Prepare input for inference with TreePPL — treeppl_input
code: coinflips <- tibble::tibble(coinflips = sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), 20, replace = TRUE)) input <- treeppl_input(object_list = coinflips, file_path = "coin_input.json")
